Know Your Rights
Know Your Rights

Who may file an EEO Complaint?
Who may file an EEO Complaint?

◼ A federal employee (or recent ex-employee) or job applicant for federal employment who believes that he or she has been retaliated or discriminated against by the agency.
◼ A federal employee (or recent ex-employee) ◼ A
f e d e r a l
e m p l o y e e
( o r
r e c e n t
e x - e m p l o y e e )
or job applicant for federal employment who
believes that he or she has been retaliated or
discriminated against by the agency.

What is an EEO Complaint?
What is an EEO Complaint?

◼ It is the claim of discrimination against an employee or an applicant for employment based on race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability or age.
◼ It is the claim of discrimination against an ◼ I t
i s
t h e
c l a i m
o f
d i s c r i m i n a t i o n
a g a i n s t
a n
employee or an applicant for employment
based on race, color, religion, sex, national
origin, disability or age.

Are there any time limits for filing?
Are there any time limits for filing?

◼ Complainants must contact an EEO
◼ Complainants must contact an EEO ◼ C o m p l a i n a n t s
m u s t
c o n t a c t
a n

counselor within 45 days of the effective date of the personnel action or within 45 days of the occurrence of the action which led to EEO contact.

Quiz
Quiz

There are seven forms or bases of employment
There are seven forms or bases of employment

discrimination which are covered by the EEO Discrimination Complaint process. Two of them are “Race” and “Color”. The other five are?
discrimination which are covered by the EEO

USDA’s Equal Opportunity Statement
USDA’s Equal Opportunity Statement

◼ The U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA) prohibits
◼ The U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA) prohibits ◼ T h e
U . S .
D e p a r t m e n t
o f
A g r i c u l t u r e
( U S D A )
p r o h i b i t s

discrimination in all its programs and activities on the basis of race, color, national origin, gender, religion, age, disability, political beliefs, sexual orientation, and marital or family status. (Not all prohibited bases apply to all programs.) Persons with disabilities who require alternative means for communication of program information (Braille, large print, audiotape, etc.) should contact USDA’s TARGET Center at 202-720-2600 (voice and TDD).
discrimination in all its programs and activities on the basis of
race, color, national origin, gender, religion, age, disability,
political beliefs, sexual orientation, and marital or family status.
(Not all prohibited bases apply to all programs.) Persons with
disabilities who require alternative means for communication of
program information (Braille, large print, audiotape, etc.) should
contact USDA’s TARGET Center at 202-720-2600 (voice and
TDD).
